## MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 73, 562, 87]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 83, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 744, 110]]<|/det|>
1 Solve the equation \(\frac{\mathrm{e}^{x}+2 \mathrm{e}^{-x}}{\mathrm{e}^{x}-3}=4\). Give your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 79, 99, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 81, 144, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 918, 112]]<|/det|>
2 (a) Expand \((6-x)(1-2 x)^{-\frac{3}{2}}\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\), simplifying the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 651, 144, 668]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 650, 621, 668]]<|/det|>
(b) State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion is valid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
3 On an Argand diagram shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) which satisfy both the inequalities \(|z-3 \mathrm{i}| \leqslant 2\) and \(\frac{1}{4} \pi \leqslant \arg (z-1-2 \mathrm{i}) \leqslant \frac{3}{4} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 579, 91]]<|/det|>
4 Solve the equation \(3 \cot x-4 \cot 2 x=3\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 918, 108]]<|/det|>
5 The square roots of \(-1-4 \sqrt{ } 5 \mathrm{i}\) can be expressed in the Cartesian form \(x+\mathrm{i} y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 121, 918, 140]]<|/det|>
By first forming a quartic equation in \(x\) or \(y\), find the square roots of \(-1-4 \sqrt{ } 5 \mathrm{i}\) in exact Cartesian form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 76, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 638, 91]]<|/det|>
6 (a) By sketching a suitable pair of graphs, show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 102, 567, 125]]<|/det|>
\[
\left|x-2\right|=2 \sin \frac{1}{2} x
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 136, 504, 154]]<|/det|>
has only one root in the interval \(0<x<\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 508, 144, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 507, 603, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Show by calculation that this root lies between 1 and 1.5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 918, 115]]<|/det|>
(c) Use the iterative formula \(x_{n+1}=2-2 \sin \frac{1}{2} x_{n}\) with an initial value of 1.03 to calculate the root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 78, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
7 (a) Express \(7 \sin \theta+24 \cos \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta-\alpha)\), where \(R>0\) and \(0<\alpha<\frac{1}{2} \pi\). Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 79, 144, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 687, 98]]<|/det|>
（b）Hence solve the equation \(7 \sin \frac{1}{3} x+24 \cos \frac{1}{3} x=24.5\) for \(0<x<\pi\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 99, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 534, 91]]<|/det|>
8 The variables \(x\) and \(\theta\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 98, 606, 128]]<|/det|>
\[
\sin 2 \theta \frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} \theta}=(4 x+3) \cos 2 \theta,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 323, 156]]<|/det|>
and \(x=0\) when \(\theta=\frac{1}{12} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 702, 184]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and obtain an expression for \(x\) in terms of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 753, 91]]<|/det|>
9 With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A, B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 98, 740, 157]]<|/det|>
\[
\overrightarrow{O A}=\left(\begin{array}{r}
1 \\
-4 \\
2
\end{array}\right), \quad \overrightarrow{O B}=\left(\begin{array}{r}
-2 \\
1 \\
3
\end{array}\right) \quad \text { and } \quad \overrightarrow{O C}=\left(\begin{array}{r}
2 \\
3 \\
5
\end{array}\right)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 168, 144, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 166, 559, 185]]<|/det|>
(a) Find a vector equation for the line through \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 508, 144, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 505, 592, 524]]<|/det|>
(b) Using a scalar product, find the exact value of \(\cos B A C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 485, 91]]<|/det|>
（c）Hence find the exact area of triangle \(A B C\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 75, 116, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 78, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 651, 95]]<|/det|>
10 (a) Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{2}\) is divided by \(1+4 x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 664, 144, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 657, 484, 691]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{0.5} x \tan ^{-1}(2 x) \mathrm{d} x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
11

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 92, 633, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 288, 848, 307]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=5 \sin 2 x \cos ^{2} x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2} \pi\) and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 320, 144, 337]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 320, 420, 337]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
(b) By using the substitution \(u=\cos x\), find the area of the region bounded by the curve, the \(x\)-axis between \(x=0\) and \(x=\frac{1}{4} \pi\), and the line \(x=\frac{1}{4} \pi\).

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 72, 562, 88]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 102, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
